thesis.description: As is evident from the following historical account, which the author believes to be fairly representative of the investigations of the thermal coefficient of expansion of various rocks hitherto carried out, the previous experiments have mostly been conducted at comparatively low temperatures. In fact, it would even seem that almost no trustworthy work upon rocks where the temperature range was comparatively large, say from 20° to 1000° C, has up to this time been published. [...]
thesis.creator: Wheeler, Nathaniel E.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The thermal expansion of rocks.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis attempts to elucidate the evolution of the relationship between poetry and mysticism during the 20th century. Mysticism utilizes a form of language which is quite similar to poetry. The object of our research is to identify the main similarities in poetry and mysticism in order to better clarify mystic poetry as a literary genre. In the first chapter, we will compare poetry and mysticism, exploring similarities between. The two disciplines that will define a genre that may be labelled mystlc poetry. In the second Chapter, we will examine four French and Quebecois poets and analyse the relationship between their conception of poetry and the vocabulary of biblical theology, attempting to explain how their verses represent a research into the supernatural. In the process, we will delineate four major tendencies of 2Oth century mystic poetry : biblical, liturgical, prophetic, monastic. The last chapter will permit us to better understand the relationship between aesthetic and mystical experiences and how poetry can be lived as a spirItual experience.

Ce mémoire porte sur l'évolution des rapports entre la poésie et la mystique au XXe siècle. La mystique utilise une forme du langage qui s'apparente à la poésie. Dans ce travail, nous voulons éclaircir les notions essentielles de l'une comme de l'autre afin de mieux situer la poésie mystique comme genre littéraire. Dans le premier chap1tre, nous établirons des comparaisons précises entre la poésie et la mystique af1n d'en faire ressortir les similitudes qui nous permettront de définir le genre que nous appellerons poésie mystique. Ainsi, le deuxième chap1tre présentera quatre poètes français et québécois dans l'œuvre desquels nous pourrons analyser comment leur conception de la poésie se rapproche du vocabulaire de théologie biblique et pourquoi leurs vers expriment une recherche du surnaturel. Nous pourrons alors délimiter quatre principales tendances de la poésie mystique au XXe siècle: biblique, liturgique, prophétique et monastique. Le troisième chap1tre permettra de mieux comprendre les rapports qui existent entre les expériences esthétiques et mystiques et comment la poésie peut être vécue comme une expérience spirituelle.
thesis.creator: Des Rosiers Grégoire, Louis
thesis.subject: French poetry -- History and criticism.
French-Canadian poetry -- Québec (Province) -- History and criticism.
Mysticism and poetry.
thesis.title: La poésie mystique française et québécoise au XXe siècle
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of the investigation to be described in this thesis was, as its title indicates, to ascertain the advisability of using classified feed for the Wilfley Table.mThere are at present three theories held in connectionmwith the feed to Wilfley tables. Many authorities, headedmby Prof. Richards, are of the opinion that classified feed is the best ; many others argue that sized feed produces results superior to those obtained by use of classified feed while a third group of authorities claim that natural or mixed feed gives the best results. [...]

thesis.description: In these days of close commercial competition the line between the success or failure of many industrial enterprises is often perilously narrow and their directors must needs either revert to the uncivilized methods of our predecessors - the robber barons - or devise some method of raising the efficiency of their producing plant in order to continue making a reasonable profit. Mine owners have found this out to their cost as silent mills in many parts of the country hear witness. The cause of their closing down is no doubt not directlytraceable to competition, but is in many cases due to the lowering of the grade of ore produced by the mine. [...]

thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: The efficiency of fine screening devices, with particular reference to the Callow revolving belt screen as a means of preparing crushed ore for treatment upon the Wilfley table.

thesis.description: Lucius Annaeus Seneca, son of Marcus A.Seneca the rhetorician, was born at Cordova in Spain probably a few years before Christ. Without going into details , it may be said that hisearly training was very much like that of the youth of his time After having mastered the rudiments, he was sent to a rhetorician, where he spent considerable time and attention on the suasoriae and controversiae, so necessary for the education of a Koiaan youth in the time of the Empire. Abandoning rhetoric, he pursued the more congenial study, as he thought, of philosophy, accepting the Stoic principles. [...]

thesis.title: Seneca and his Greek models.

thesis.description: In presenting this paper, by way of introduction it may be of interest to make a brief resume of the historical evolution of the subject of Geology. history of the development of any subject, scientific or otherwise, is but a biographical sketch of the men who are responsible for its growth; so in following from its infancy the progress and development of the subject of geology, I shall select a few of the men who have the honour to be classed as the founders of one of our most modern and instructive sciences, and describe briefly the work they accomplished by their fine observation, untiring efforts and keen appreciation of the facts that nature so bountifully supplied. [...]

thesis.description: Lord Grey the Governor General of Canada when he opened the Royal Canadian Academy Exhibition in 1910 urged upon his hearers the development of the "spirit of criticism", which mnay be defined as the art of judging; and Professor Dow of Columbia University says that a training which calls for the exercise of critical powers will of necessity increase an individual's efficiency. To quote Miss Puffer on the subject "The true end of criticima is to tell us whence and why the charm of a work of art: to disengage" to explain, to measure, and to certify it. And this explanation of charm, and this stmnping it with the seal of approval, is possible by the help and only by the help of the science of aestheticsa science now only in its beginning, but greatly to be desired in its full development". [...]

thesis.description: The role of marine bacteria in the economy of oceanic life is little known, although increasing attention has been devoted to its study since the latter part of the 19th and the beginning of the 20th century. This increased interest has not resulted in any etailed study of the physiology of marine bacteria as a group, nor has any attempt been made to classify them. No decisive information can be gleaned from the literature as to the probable position that marine bacteria may occupy in the scheme of living oceanic life or in the cycle of the decomposition of its dead inhabitants.[...]
thesis.creator: Bedford, Robert Henry
thesis.subject: Bacteria
Marine life
thesis.title: The vertical distribution of marine bacteria in the northern Pacific Ocean
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Due to the fact that American nursery men discovered that fruit stocks could be bought in France and imported into America for less than they themselves could grow them, importations of foreign nursery stock increased from year to year. The importation of nursery stock into Canada and the United States was the means of introducing and distributing new and dangerous insect pests and fungous diseases which today constitute a serious economic problem and a menace to prosperity. [...]

thesis.subject: Horticulture.
thesis.title: A study of the laws relating to the importation and movement of nursery stock; and the control of insect pests and fungous diseases in Canada and the United States.

thesis.description: Before proceeding with an account of the experimental work, some of the definitions and general principles applicable to the concentration of ores will be given. DEFINITION: "An ORE is a natural aggregation of minerals from which a metal or metallic compound can be recovered with profit on a large scale." (The minerals which make up an ore deposit do not belong to any one class of rocks or minerals, but are oxides, sulphides, carbonates, chlorides or metallic salts in general.) [...]

thesis.description: When two bodies A and B are brought into thermal communication in such a way that no heat is developed or destroyed by chemical, mechanical, electrical or other actions between the bodies, it is assumed that the quantity of heat which A loses is the same as that which B gains and inversely. Since, according to this assumption, calorimetric measurements extend only to quantities of heat imparted to bodies or given out by them, they do not lead to any conclusions as to the total amount of heat contained in a body at a given temperature. [...]
thesis.creator: Sullivan, Charles T.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The specific heat of mercury by the water-cooled method of continuous flow calorimetry.
